intro.description: A cheat sheet which demonstrates generating a Rails project, setting up the configuration and generating a resource.

item.title: Open the Rails perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the Rails perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > Rails or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create a Rails project
item.description: In the main toolbar, click on the New Rails Project button, or click on the link below. Enter rails for the project name, then click Finish.

item.title: Rails project generation output
item.description:
As the rails command is run to generate your project, you should see the Rails Shell appear in the Console view.
This view will show the output of the rails command and creates hyperlinks for the generated files. You can use those links to quickly open the files.
Additionally this view is an alternate way of entering rails related commands in a shell/console fashion - including the ability to run the rails command to generate rails projects.

item.title: Open the database.yml file
item.description:
Now that you have your Rails project, you'll want to edit/verify your database connection settings.
Click the link for config/database.yml in the Rails Shell (you'll likely need to scroll up), or expand the project in the Ruby Explorer and double-click the file.

item.title: Edit/Verify your database settings
item.description:
Edit and/or verify your database settings.
If you are using sqlite, there's not much to do.
With other databases you'll want to enter the username, password, host and port information. You'll also need to manually create the database outside RadRails.
